contentrichtext.text: [[File:Ernst Brenner.gif|thumb|right|Ernst Brenner]] '''Ernst Brenner''' (December 9, 1856 – March 11, 1911) was a [[Switzerland|Swiss]] politician. He was elected to the [[Federal Council of Switzerland]] on March 25, 1897 and died in office on March 11, 1911. He was affiliated to the [[Free Democratic Party of Switzerland|Free Democratic Party]]. During his office time he held the following departments: * [[Department of Justice and Police]] (1897 - 1900) * [[Political Department]] as [[President of the Confederation (Switzerland)|President of the Confederation]] (1901) * [[Department of Justice and Police]] (1902 - 1907) * Political Department as President of the Confederation (1908) * [[Department of Justice and Police]] (1909 - 1911) == External links == * {{Swiss Federal Councillor|38}} * {{HDS|4434}} {{start box}} {{succession box | before = [[Robert Comtesse]] | title =[[President of the Swiss National Council|President of the National Council]]| years = 1894/1895 | after = [[Johann Jakob Bachmann]]}} {{succession box | before = [[Emil Frey]] | title = [[Member of the Swiss Federal Council]] | years = 1897–1911 | after = [[Arthur Hoffmann (politician)|Arthur Hoffmann]]}} {{end box}} {{Swiss Presidents}} {{commonscat|Ernst Brenner}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Brenner, Ernst | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = December 9, 1856 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = March 11, 1911 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Brenner, Ernst}} [[Category:1856 births]] [[Category:1911 deaths]] [[Category:Members of the Swiss Federal Council]] [[Category:People from Basel-Stadt]] {{Switzerland-politician-stub}}
